Black Rose Dragon is my favorite card in all of Yu-Gi-Oh! It got some great support recently so I wanted to make a deck around it along with a ton of other rose cards.

deck_excerpt: A deck which prioritizes Albaz + Dark Magician synergy.
deck_description: This is a dark magician deck I was currently working on. It was somewhat inspired by an earlier tournament version of the deck. The goal is to use the resilience of Albaz to get out some of the Dark Magician's win conditions such as the Dragon Knight combo or the Dragoon. Because of the how the Albaz deck works, I found that Albaz's cards can kinda deal with most threats on win duels on its own. I would want to be able to get out a Dragon Knight combo a bit faster, but you will likely last long enough to bring it out for duels. That, or you won't need it.
Bystial Branded Despia
control
Purrely

deck_excerpt: Yugi-Boy! It's a Toon World out there!
deck_description: This is by far my favorite archetype and the one I use almost all the time. I love the concept of "Toonifying" monsters like in the anime. Get Toon Kingdom out on the field, use Red Stone to get out Toon Red-Eyes in defense. Get enough toons out on the field in defense position equal to your opponents life points, then shock them by directly attacking them to zero after switching them all into attack position on your turn. Such a fun deck used by one of the best  "villans" in Yu-Gi-Oh! Enjoy!
Twink Turbo
Ghoti with some Superheavy Samurai, not sure on side deck or main deck handtraps

deck_excerpt: What if Sergey Volkov dueled today?
deck_description:
Sergey Volkov Deck adapted to today's format

Let me know if you know how to improve it

Just a build i'm messing around with currently. Probably not great, but it definitely churns out rank 8's like no one's business.

The handfixing is pretty insane from what I've messed with considering the dangers draw you cards if they don't get sniped, Trade-in hits every card except ken/gen the stones and the sage, sarcophagus pitches any card (four times btw lmao what is that even) you don't need and fills the grave with all the names. 

Zombie Vampire is pretty nice too, you typically get to go for another rank 8 after or you might hit a stone/sage so you can make Spirit for a graveyard negate and tag out into azure to protect Hope Harbinger. The second Giantrainer is actually just the new Fire King Garunix Rank 8 but that's not in the database yet. 

The deck is extremely simple but I feel like it has a decent amount of overall versatility just from playing the game. Jet bounces a card and will summon itself back from the GY for free basically, Dragon Spirit banishes S/T every time it's specialed so you're usually atleast sniping one thing with it per time, Alternative Blue-Eyes actually has good use since you can destroy the Ken you give them then use it as material for a rank 8, Giantrainer is just... more draws. You literally always make Photon Lord first and the "combo" (lol) is incredibly safe. 

Obligatory playing Linkuriboh because some how eventually you'll brick on some garbage like 3 unusable horus + stone + vanilla blue-eyes

 

Try it out, see what you want to change and tell me about it.

deck_excerpt: The Six Shinobi Turn Skip Win ft. Primal Seed
deck_description:
Greetings! In this deck, we will skip our opponent's turn with "The Six Shinobi" and slash will all six samurai. Let's hack and slash!

 

 

Gameplan

1) Place ME-PSY-YA on Pendulum Zone and Special Summon Chaos Emperor Dragon. This setup is needed to find combo pieces from Banish Zone (BZ) with "Primal Seed" cards.

2) Special Summon Makyura with Saryuja and destroy both with Offerings.

3) Play "Contract with the Void" to send all "Six Samurai" monsters from your hand to GY. Don't send "Primal Seed" to BZ by accident.

4) After you have revived 3 x Six Samurai with "Monster Reborn", bring forth Rihan and place him on Extra Monster Zone (EMZ) and nowhere else.

5) Revive the remaining Six Samurai monsters and then, activate "The Six Shinobi" because you have 6 x Six Samurai with different attributes. Then, end your turn.

6) Thanks to turn skip, you can hack and slash with all Six Samurai to win the game.

 

If you wonder how to save up some SR and UR points, I can show you:

- "Monster Reborn" + "Reinforcement of the Army" are given for free, if you have played the tutorial to save 60 UR!

- "Pot of Avarice" can be collected by purchasing "Re-Contract Universe" deck. 90 SR saved and you can try a new deck!

- "Into The Void" + "Allure of Darkness" can be found within "The Infinite Void" Secret Pack to save 180 SR!

- "Primal Seed" + "Pot of Acquistiveness" + "Ravenous" + "Makyura" can be found within "Legacy Pack" to save 90 SR and 60 UR!

- "Number 60: Dugares the Timeless" can be found within "Number Recall" Secret Pack to save 30 SR!

- "Secret Six Samurai - Rihan" can be found within "Great Shogun's Rule" Secret Pack to save 30 SR!

- "Formula Synchron" can be found within "Stardust Ties" Secret Pack to save 60 SR!

- "T.G. Hyper Librarian" can be found within "Futuristic Creatures" Secret Pack to save 30 UR!

- "Wonder Wand" and "Spellbook of Knowledge" can be collected by purchasing "Spellbook of Prophecy" deck. 120 SR saved and you can try a new deck!

 

So, in total, you can save up to 600 SR and 150 UR, if you are willing to spend some gems. Other SR and UR cards I didn't mention are essential.

 

That's all for this one. If you have any questions, feel free to ask. Have fun in Master Duel!

deck_excerpt: Destroy your opponents whole field again and again on their turn!!!
deck_description:
The video is highly recommended for anyone who wants to see the full combo and particular situations like getting negated from a hand trap (credits to Nerd Factor for creating it, he did a REALLY good job)!!!

MAIN COMBO:

You want to send Darkwuirm to your gy to special summon him with his effect and grab a Supreme King Gate Magician, you activate Gate Magician and destroy him to activate a Gate Zero from your deck. After that you want to normal summon any monster to link it and darkwuirm away for Beyond the Pendulum and with its effect get lightwuirm, then pend summon using lightwuirm and Gate Zero, the Gate Magician and darkwuirm from your FU extra deck and activate the Gate Magician's effect and grab Soul of the Supreme Celestial Being, set it and end your turn. On the opponent's turn you can activate the Soul of the Supreme Celestial Being, tribute Gate Magician and banish the Fusion, Synchro, Xyz and pendulum dragons so that Z-ARC can activate its effect of clearing the opponent's field, then activate lightwuirm, special summon it and return from the extra deck the Gate Magician you tributed and then you can synchro using lightwuirm's effect and targeting darkwuirm the Supreme King Dragon Clear Wing (lightwuirm needs to become dark because it requires a dark tuner monster). After that you will have completed your combo and have cleared the opponent's whole field once and destroyed every face-up monster your opponent summoned after that using Supreme King Dragon Clear Wing! GL HF!!!

deck_excerpt: Therion Sunavalon Rikka  / Latina WCQ Regional Top 4
deck_description:
Category: Tournament Meta Decks (TCG)

Tournament Meta Decks are current-level Meta Decks that are capable of going up against the best of the best. These are curated lists that cannot be uploaded by regular users.

Creator: Alessandro Della Guardia

Tournament: Latina WCQ Regional – October 22nd 2023

Placement: Top 4

I was going to bring pure Ghoti to locals, but made this as a fun theorycraft. Turns out this deck can end on pretty scary boards including quick synchros + I:P -> S:P + Red/Carrot negate + 1 or 2 backrow. The self-banish from S:P can also turn on other Ghoti plays during your opponent's turn.

Hello and welcome to another guide, where I'll be explaining how to FTK with C9. Here, C101 will play an important role in that regard. Let's jump into action!

 

 

Gameplan

1) Place ME-PSY-YA on Pendulum Zone and Special Summon Chaos Emperor Dragon. This setup is needed to find combo pieces from Banish Zone (BZ) with "Primal Seed" cards.

2) Make sure you have 2 x Level 4 monsters at your side to XYZ Summon Gunkan. Utilize either Saryuja or "Monster Reborn" and while at it, activate "Black Garden".

3) Overlay into C101 with "Barian's Force" by using Gunkan as material. If you have planted flowers to opposing side and Special Summoned with "Monster Reborn", you can gift them to opponent by playing "Mystic Box". Destroy a rose to give it and then, attach said monster as material for C101. You can also reset C101 with Book spells, for your information.

4) Your aim should be to have at least 10 materials with C101 but the more, the merrier. When you think it's enough, overlay into "Barian Hope" via C101. Then, activate "Clockwork Night" to change the type of all monsters on the battlefield to Machine.

5) With required type/attribute/rank present, activate "Astral Force" to jump into "Number 9" and lead the way with "Barian's Force" to C9.

6) Activate both abilities of C9 for the FTK.

 

If you wonder how to save up some SR and UR points, I can show you:

- "Monster Reborn" is given for free, if you have played the tutorial to save 30 UR!

- "Pot of Avarice" can be collected by purchasing "Re-Contract Universe" deck. 90 SR saved and you can try a new deck!

- "Into The Void" + "Allure of Darkness" can be found within "The Infinite Void" Secret Pack to save 180 SR!

- "Primal Seed" + "Pot of Acquistiveness" can be found within "Legacy Pack" to save 30 SR and 60 UR!

- "Rank-Up-Magic Astral Force" can be found within "Number Recall" Secret Pack to save 30 SR!

- "Black Garden" can be found within "Exquisite Jet-Black Rose" Secret Pack to save 30 SR!

- "Number 9: Dyson Sphere" can be found within "Colossal Mech" Secret Pack to save 30 SR!

- "Formula Synchron" can be found within "Stardust Ties" Secret Pack to save 30 SR!

- "T.G. Hyper Librarian" can be found within "Futuristic Creatures" Secret Pack to save 30 UR!

- "Rank-Up-Magic Barian's Force" + "Number C101" + "CXyz Barian Hope" can be found within "Sword of the Seventh One" Secret Pack to save 60 SR and 30 UR!

- "Wonder Wand" and "Spellbook of Knowledge" can be collected by purchasing "Spellbook of Prophecy" deck. 120 SR saved and you can try a new deck!

 

So, in total, you can save up to 600 SR and 150 UR, if you are willing to spend some gems. Other SR and UR cards I didn't mention are essential.

 

That's all for this one. If you have any questions, feel free to ask. Have fun in Master Duel!

deck_description:
Category: Tournament Meta Decks (TCG)

Tournament Meta Decks are current-level Meta Decks that are capable of going up against the best of the best. These are curated lists that cannot be uploaded by regular users.

deck_excerpt: HASHIRI DA SHITA, OMOI GA IMA DEMO
deck_description:
My pre-release Centurion decklist I've been slowly building up. Centurion's a fairly small engine, and you can play it in a variety of decks that don't block Synchro Summons, although playing it pure or with a couple of small resource engines splashed in feels like the most optimal move, since you can fit plenty of non-engine staples to supplement and insure plays.

The basic Centurion strategy is this: simple combos that spit out Level 8 and Level 12 Synchros left and right, during your turn and during your opponent's turn with the help of your Field Spell. Your main-deck Centurions will be constantly shifting between being monsters and being Continuous Traps - the fact that they're Traps allow you to use their effect to Special Summon themselves during the opponent's turn, and the cards all work together to protect each other when they're not tagging in and out - Primera protects your high-level cards from effect destruction, Legatia provides your low-strength cards with battle immunity, and Stand-Up Centurion! protects itself when a Centurion monster exists. It's an incredibly easy strategy to pick up, but where the average player separates from the advanced is how you follow-up - you might be able to King Calamity your opponent once in a while, but if that gets blocked, utilizing your surviving pieces is crucial for you to build back, which this deck can do if it really needs to.

Basic Centurion Combo - 1.5 card combo (requires Stand-Up Centurion! + 1 other card), survives Droll, cannot be Nibiru'd:

  1. Activate Stand-Up Centurion!
  2. Use Stand-Up Centurion!, discard 1 card for cost
    • Resolve: Place Centurion Primera from Deck into S/T Zone as Continuous Trap
  3. Use Centurion Primera
    • Resolve: Special Summon Centurion Primera from S/T Zone
    • On Resolution: Trigger Centurion Primera
      • Resolve: Add Centurion Trudea
  4. Normal Summon Centurion Trudea
  5. Activate Centurion Trudea
    • Resolve: Place Centurion Trudea from Field into S/T Zone and place Centurion Emet VI from Deck into S/T Zone
  6. Use Centurion Emet VI
    • Resolve: Special Summon Centurion Emet VI from S/T Zone
  7. Synchro Summon Centurion Legatia using Centurion Primera and Centurion Emet VI
    • On Summon: Trigger Centurion Legatia
      • Resolve: Draw 1 card
  8. During End Phase: Activate Centurion Legatia
    • Resolve: Place Centurion Primera from GY into S/T Zone.
  9. During Opponent's Turn, when it's safe: Use Centurion Primera CL1, Use Centurion Trudea CL2
    • Resolve: Special Summon Centurion Trudea from S/T Zone and increase its Level to 8; Special Summon Centurion Primera from S/T Zone
    • On Resolution: Trigger Centurion Primera CL1, Trigger Stand-Up Centurion! CL2, Activate Centurion Emet VI from GY CL3 targeting Centurion Trudea
      • Resolve: Special Summon Centurion Emet VI from GY and place Centurion Trudea into S/T Zone; Synchro Summon whatever Synchro is best for the situation; add whatever Centurion card is best follow-up for next turn

The best play (until it inevitably gets banned) is to summon Crimson Dragon, then using its Quick Effect immediately to summon Hot Red Dragon Archfiend King Calamity, which will lock your opponent out of all on-field effects for the rest of their turn, allowing you to run with that momentum for the remainder of that Duel.

If you start with Emblema of Oath, you can use that to Set Stand-Up Centurion! from your Deck and make plays like normal.

If you start with Centurion Primera, you can Normal Summon Primera to add Stand-Up Centurion! to your hand. From there, you activate Stand-Up, use its effect to discard to place Trudea into the S/T Zone, Special Summon it, then continue plays from step 5.

If you start with Centurion Trudea, you can Normal Summon Trudea, use its effect to place Primera into the S/T Zone, Special Summon Primera, add and activate Stand-Up, then use Stand-Up to place Emet VI into the S/T Zone. From there, continue plays from step 6.

If you have all the combo pieces you need while you're building during your first turn, add Truth Centurion instead of a second Stand-Up or another Centurion monster - this gets you an omni-negate for next turn in case the opponent has a strong hand or GY effect to try to break you. During your opponents turn, for the Primera search, I like adding Faith of Centurion on the off-chance your Legatia is outed during the turn - you can use it to recoup the Primera that Legatia would have re-placed, giving you material for another Synchro on your turn.

Now for the side engines and unorthodox staples.

A minimal Bystial package with 1 Magnamhut and 3 Druiswurm acts as powerful GY disruption, can provide bodies on the board for defense, and provide strong effects. Druiswurm's non-destruction removal is always solid when it gets triggered, and Magnamhut can either fetch a Druiswurm or recoup a lost Signer Dragon. In addition, them all being Level 6 opens up the Level 10 Synchro package of Chaos Angel and Baronne de Fleur, in case your initial plays get interrupted and you only have Primera on-board.

Two Kashtira Fenrir give you a good option going first or second - you can summon the first, search the second, then use the second as your discard fodder for Stand-Up. And of course, there's its second effect that banishes one of your opponent's cards face-down if they use a monster effect. Finally, it being Level 7 opens up the Level 11 Synchro package without wasting your Normal Summon on Ash Blossom - specifically, Psychic End Punisher.

Because of the large amount of space for hand traps, I've elected to run a Crossout Designator package, split between the Main and Side Decks. As good as this deck is against Droll and Nib, a well-timed Ash or Imperm can stop your plays if you didn't draw a second piece of follow-up. Splitting the negation between Effect Veiler and Infinite Impermenance gives you counterplay against both if you draw Crossout in your opening hand, and of course, running Ash Blossom at 3 is almost never a bad thing. There is also one copy of Nibiru in your Main Deck, in case you get the chance to go crazy - while a basic Centurion combo only performs four Summons, placing Fenrir or a Bystial on the board before that during the same turn will land you with a Primal Being Token as soon as Legatia is summoned. As for your Side Deck handtraps, you have two more copies of Nibiru for actual use, 1 Droll and Lock Bird, just in case you're forced to use Terraforming or Prosperity, 1 Ghost Ogre and Snow Rabbit, which would kill your Stand-Up if not countered, and 1 Dimension Shifter, which is a Garnet for you but also shuts down a floodgate that would kill your ability to recoup resources.

There Can Be Only One is just your average side-board floodgate. The only Centurions that match types are Legatia and Emet VI, meaning you can play under this card most of the time.

This is absolutely not the final version of the deck. Like all archetypes that originate from Deck Build Sets, there's likely going to be new support in future releases, and I didn't even elect to add Bonfire to this list, which is just another 1-3 copies of Trudea - I wanted to keep this list restrained to Valiant Smashers and earlier, to make it as accessible as possible to the earliest adopters of this archetype. Centurion has had incredible results in the OCG, and I'm looking forward to being one of the first to run it here in the TCG.
Generaider

Category: Tournament Meta Decks (TCG)

Tournament Meta Decks are current-level Meta Decks that are capable of going up against the best of the best. These are curated lists that cannot be uploaded by regular users.

Creator: Kaan Inis

Tournament: Köln WCQ Regional – October 21st 2023

Placement: 2nd Place
Raidraptor (Oct 2023) V2
Exodia
A mix of Visas, Scareclaw, Mannadium & Veda stuff.
Pianta Synchro

My first draft of a Raidraptor deck using the new support from PHNI, as I get the opportunity to test more I will continue to improve the ratios.

The cards in the side deck are cards I reckon could be run but I haven't gotten the chance to test yet.

 

The new support is amazing, here are my thoughts on the new cards:

Raidraptor - Noir Lanius is both an amazing combo starting and flexible extender. This card is a one card combo, able to search Raidraptor - Pain Lanius by targeting itself allowing you to summon Raidraptor - Force Strix and begin comboing. It's second effect is useful allowing easier access to the rank 3 and 5 Raptors increasing the flexibility of your combos.

Raidraptor - Bloom Vulture is an amazing extender and recovery tool. The first effect allows you to continue swarm and if it can be activated with no monsters on field it'll mean that these birds no longer lose to their normal summon being negated. It's second effect gives the deck extra grind game and gives you a way to explosively recover on turn 3/4+.

Raidraptor - Roost is the searcher, recycler and draw power the deck needed all in one! Allowing you to search for Raidraptor spell/traps on BOTH turns means more flexible combos and more resources for next turn. It's second effect might not seem as strong but I reckon it's secretly the better effect of the two, by shuffling back birds we can now run less copies of cards such as Raidraptor - Force Strix and reset our graveyard so we can keep comboing next turn, plus the draw effect is an added bonus letting us extend further and making giving us a higher likelihood of drawing any handtraps we decide to run.

Raidraptor - Barrage is a nice form of negation and a nice recycler. Sadly the first effect does target which means some cards will be immune to it, however because it can target any card as long as you have a raptor XYZ on field you can use it to deal with troublesome continuous effects (cough cough Kashtira Birth cough). The graveyard effect is an alright one as well by getting one your birds back to hand from either grave or banished your turn 3/4+ will be more explosive, plus you can do some funny stuff such as recovering and using Raidraptor - Booster Strix twice in one turn.

Rise-Rank-Up-Magic Raidraptor's Force is honestly insane, it is both an amazing RUM card and technically a form of interaction. By letting you essential treat an XYZ summon like a Synchro summon you can very easily get to any of the higher ranking Raptors and because it can be activated during your opponents MAIN AND BATTLE phase you can summon cards such as Raidraptor - Satellite Cannon Falcon and the new Raidraptor - Rising Rebellion Falcon to disrupt you opponent's strategy.

Raidraptor - Brave Strix is a great searcher and a nice attack booster for your bigger birds making them just that bit tougher. Being summonable off of Raider's Knight means it is easily accessable and with the ability to search any Raptor spell/trap or RUM spell its an incredibly flexible combo piece. It's attack boosting effect though not that impressive is also a nice bonus, giving cards such as Raidraptor - Ultimate Falcon an extra 1000 attack means NOTHING the opponent has is going to beat it in battle.

And finally last but not least:

Raidraptor - Rising Rebellion Falcon is incredible boss for the archetype, a towers, an interruption thanks to the new RUM spell, and has a lot of potential for shenanigans. Destroy EVERY card the opponent has on summon is great especially since it can be summon on their turn and the fact that it burns for the combined original attack of every destroyed monster means an opponent could loss just by trying to push for lethal. The restriction on the burn damage might seem a little annoying but is in reality really easily to meet. The fact that monster is UNAFFECTED by other card's means that the opponent can't even negate it and if they somehow survive the burn damage they're gonna have a hell of a time getting off the field. It's final effect is an interesting one to say the least, being able to copy the effect of any Raptor XYZ in grave has a lot of applications from copying Raidraptor - Force Strix for a search to copying Raidraptor - Revolution Falcon for the ultimate OTK card, this effect is going to make the deck a lot more interesting to both versus and play.

 

That's all from me for now, in future versions of this deck list I intend to include basic combos and strategies to make the most of the deck and also discuss potential techs and engines that could go with.
Until then though, have a fun time playing with these new and improved rebel birds and goodbye!

deck_excerpt: VIDEO IN DESCRIPTION DROPS 11 AM EST 10/27/2023

deck_description:
It's time to cook with Number 43. You should serve the dish well with bubbling wok. Let's get cooking!

 

 

Gameplan

1) Throughout the game, Synchro Summon Maple by using Cthugua + Shamisen as materials. Then, choose WATER as attribute.

2) Throughout the game, XYZ Summon Number 13 by using 2 x Level 1 dudes as materials. Then, send it to GY either with Ravenous or as Link material for Saryuja.

3) Place ME-PSY-YA on Pendulum Zone and Special Summon Chaos Emperor Dragon. This setup is needed to find combo pieces from Banish Zone (BZ) with "Primal Seed" cards...

  • If you have discarded Necroface with Ravenous and you have "Primal Seed" card(s) with you, pick Necroface as DARK target.
  • If Number 13 is in GY, don't pick it up as DARK target by accident.

4) With Saryuja and other cards such as Panda and "Monster Reborn" assisting in filling your board, Link Summon Reef by using four monsters as materials. Thanks to attribute adjustment coming from Maple, you can use any monsters on your side as WATER monsters for requirement of Reef...

  • One of them has to be Maple and you mustn't use Chaos Emperor as material, no matter what. The reasoning behind is that "Rank-Up-Magic Launch" has to be resolved correctly.
  • Also, while Link Summoning Saryuja, don't use Maple as material at all.

5) With Maple gone, you can revive Number 13 with "Monster Reborn" and overlay into Number 43 with "Rank-Up-Magic Launch".

6) It's time to raise the ATK of Reef, so that we can FTK our opponent by tributing Reef to gain LP equal to its ATK with "Mystik Wok" and then, inflict the same amount as damage with Number 43. To accomplish, we will use Necroface + Soul Release + Different Dimension trio...

  • If Necroface is in your hand and your Main Deck has at least two cards, play "Allure of Darkness" to banish Necroface.
  • If Necroface is in your GY, you can either banish it with Chaos Emperor or "Soul Release".
  • To raise the ATK of Reef, you have to bounce Necroface back and forth between GY and BZ...
    • From GY to BZ, "Soul Release" is your friend. Always pick five monsters, including Necroface. After that, start the chain with Necroface and end it with Reef to unleash their full potential. Therefore, you will notice Reef gaining attack twice; first from "Soul Release" and second from Necroface.
    • From BZ to GY, "Different Dimension" is your friend. Always pick three monsters of yours, including Necroface, so that "Soul Release" has more fuel for Reef.

7) Congratulations, you win the game!

 

If you wonder how to save up some SR and UR points, I can show you:

- "Monster Reborn" is given for free, if you have played the tutorial to save 30 UR!

- "Pot of Avarice" can be collected by purchasing "Re-Contract Universe" deck. 90 SR saved and you can try a new deck!

- "Into The Void" + "Allure of Darkness" can be found within "The Infinite Void" Secret Pack to save 180 SR!

- "Primal Seed" + "Pot of Acquistiveness" + "Ravenous" can be found within "Legacy Pack" to save 60 SR and 60 UR!

- "Formula Synchron" can be found within "Stardust Ties" Secret Pack to save 30 SR!

- "T.G. Hyper Librarian" can be found within "Futuristic Creatures" Secret Pack to save 30 UR!

- "Bubble Reef" can be found within "Essence of Flora and Ocean" Secret Pack to save 30 SR!

- "Wonder Wand" and "Spellbook of Knowledge" can be collected by purchasing "Spellbook of Prophecy" deck. 120 SR saved and you can try a new deck!

- As of this writing, you can find "Maple Maiden" in timed pack called "Flame of Fury" to save 30 SR!

 

So, in total, you can save up to 540 SR and 120 UR, if you are willing to spend some gems. Other SR and UR cards I didn't mention are essential.

 

That's all for this one. If you have any questions, feel free to ask. Have fun in Master Duel!
